name: Heckle and Jeckle
description:
Introduction

Sandtrap needed in Heckle. Watertrap was needed in Jeckle or have to farm sand from way back for last rappel. Pakdrag in Jeckle. Must fix exit line or hard up climb to get started back up crack from balcony above the lake.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

http://bluugnome.com/cyn_route/ticaboo/ticaboo_heckle-jeckle/ticaboo_heckle-jeckle.aspx

Trip reports and media

Background

properties.name: Heckle and Jeckle (1) - Drive to Trailhead
properties.description: (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle and Jeckle (2) Approach and Canyon
properties.description: (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle and Jeckle (3) - Exit
properties.description: (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: pkHeckleJeckle
properties.description: Parking turnout on the left (south) for Heckle and Jeckle Canyons. The road is smooth and in pretty good shape but not well travelled. Park here to go to Heckel and Jeckle Canyons and hike southeast across rolling desert for about 0.32 miles to the top of the cliff band overlooking Heckle Canyon and look for a weakness to scramble down. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-01
properties.description: Weakness in the rim allowing access to the level below and the top of Heckle can be see about 800 feet away. Scramble down rubble to the next level and walk rolling slickrock over to the head of Heckle Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yHeckleTp
properties.description: Start of Heckle Canyon where shallow V slot begins to form with a mix of walking and a little galumphing over small potholes. Note: When exiting from here you can follow the approach route back up to the rim or alternately walk west about 500 feet to another weakness where you can also get up to the rim. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-02
properties.description: Easy downclimb of about 6 to 8 feet followed by a medium sized pothole that most people can easily bridge over; followed by another downclimb of 6 to 8 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHeckleR1
properties.description: Rap 1 - Heckle Canyon. Anchored using a pack drag and drops about 12 feet down slightly sloped wall. The combination of a pack drag anchor for the top and a partner assist capture at the bottom is a quick fun way to get down this drop. At the bottom is a 4 foot deep pothole to partner assist through with a 6 foot downclimb on the other side; followed by about 100 feet of easy walking and galumphing. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-03
properties.description: Wide open spot where the canyon is escapable on either side. Down canyon is a 200 foot long section with a mix of walking and easy galumphing except one large pothole at the other end. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-04
properties.description: Large pothole to partner assist through with a 6 foot downclimb on the other side. Then a short walk to where the canyon opens up again. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-05-EE
properties.description: Canyon is wide and can be escaped on either side before entering deeper slot down canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-06
properties.description: Drop of about 12 feet with a silo like feature that is easily stemmed over. About 60 feet down canyon in this narrow slot is a rappel. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHeckleR2
properties.description: Rap 2 - Heckle Canyon. Anchored using a Sandtrap and drops about 35 feet into deep slot that is then easily walked for a little over 100 feet to where the canyon opens again. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-07
properties.description: A few potholes as the canyon opens up. These can be bypassed by walking along the LDC (northeast) side. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-08-Out
properties.description: Spot where you can scramble up very steep slickrock on the RDC (west) side of the canyon to escape. This upclimb is very steep and only one person needs to do it; who can then provide a handline for others using a rope of about 80 feet. If you do not like slab style upclimbs; this will feel a bit sketchy. Note: Before climbing out here; walk about 30 feet down canyon to the drop down to the shelf below. You will be climbing back up that drop after getting to the bottom of Jeckle Canyon. If you do not feel confident leave a rope fixed to an anchor to use as a hand line to get up the drop. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-10
properties.description: Top of the upclimb out of Heckle Canyon to go to Jeckle Canyon. Route find your way southwest along the rim of Jeckle. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yJeckleTp
properties.description: Top of Jeckle Canyon where shallow slot begins to form. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Jeckle01
properties.description: Challenging downclimb of about 8 feet just after a pothole that can be walked around. Aggressive partner assist or packdrag works well here. A hole at the bottom of the drop can be galumphed over. Over the next 300 feet of canyon is a drop of about 12 feet where you can easily galumph over it and slide down where you comfortably fit followed by a waist deep pothole that can played down through but tall people can bridge over it just before the canyon opens up for about 100 feet before the to last narrows. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dJeckleR1a
properties.description: Rap 1 - Jeckle Canyon. Anchored suing a sand trap or rocks and uses about 140 feet of rope to get to the bottom. The first 80 feet of the drop is over two downclimbs over shallow potholes before dropping a vertical 60 feet to a large shelf below. The first portion of this drop through the potholes can be downclimbed through easily but anchor options at the vertical part are not easy to find. If using a couple shorter ropes tied together the joining knot can easily be placed near the top of the vertical part as there is lots of room to stand and get on rappel. If you can find anchors near the top of the vertical part of the drop; then you will need less rope. If the potholes are dry there may be rocks allowing an anchor to be built at the top of just the vertical section. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dJeckleR1b
properties.description: Rap 1 - Jeckle Canyon; top of the actual vertical part of the rap. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yJeckleBt
properties.description: Bottom of Jeckle Canyon on a large slickrock shelf. Once down on this shelf you can walk between the two forks or over to steep slickrock rolling off to the lake below. Note: If the lake is low enough you can get down to this ledge; it is a cool place to hang out. At lake level the lake was approximately 20 feet below the ledge here. If the lake level is too high; this ledge will be filed with water and not a good idea to drop down to. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yHeckleBt
properties.description: Bottom of Heckle Canyon on a large slickrock shelf. Once down on this shelf after exiting Jeckle Canyon; walk north to an upclimb into Heckle Canyon to begin the exit. Note: If the lake is low enough you can get down to this ledge; it is a cool place to hang out. At lake level the lake was approximately 20 feet below the ledge here. If the lake level is too high; this ledge will be filed with water and not a good idea to drop down to. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Heckle-09-Up
properties.description: A moderately difficult upclimb in Heckle Canyon which is ascended to exit after dropping down Jeckle Canyon. Climbing back up into Heckle Canyon here is challenging and best done with a hand line set from above. Getting into the bottom of the crack is best done with a partner assist then climbing out the top of the crack gives way to steep slab that is very exposed. When descending Heckle on this route; walk over to this drop and evaluate it for climbing back up. If there is any doubt; set a hand line up from something and leave in place for your return after getting down Jeckle Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)
